sen.e: Teaching reveals how Amida came to establish the Vows, which is expounded in Larger Sutra of the Buddha of Immeasurable Life; the Vows themselves; and how everything relies on Amida's directing of virtues based on his wisdom and compassion.

Teaching shows how Amida came to establish the Vows, which is expounded in the Larger Sutra of the Buddha of Immeasurable Life; the Vows themselves; and how everything relies on Amida's directing of virtues based on his wisdom and compassion.

Teaching shows how Amida came to establish the Vows, which is expounded in "Bussetsu Muryoju-kyo" (the Sutra of the Buddha of Immeasurable Life); the Vows themselves; and how everything relies on Amida's directing of virtues based on his wisdom and compassion.

sen.j: 行とは、凡夫が往生のために行う行ではなく、阿弥陀仏が行じ終わってその功徳を凡夫に回向するとする。
sen.e: Practice is not a foolish being's practice of directing his or her own merit toward attainment of birth, but is the fulfilled practice that Amida directs to beings out of great compassion.
sen.cmt: 「行とは」で始まり「回向する」という原文の文章としての構造があいまいで、意味が把握できかねます。ただの訳文にボールド字の部分があり、内容が極めて似ていることから少し構文を変えて借用しました。いわば仮訳です。念のために「浄土文類聚抄」の該当箇所および相当の参考訳文を掲載しておきます：「聖言・論説、特にもって知んぬ。凡夫回向の行にあらず、これ大悲回向の行なるがゆえに、「不回向」と名づく。」With these passages from the sacred words of the Buddha and from the treatises, we know in particular that the great practice is not a foolish being's practice of directing his or her own merit toward attainment of birth. It is the fulfilled practice that Amida directs to beings out of great compassion, and therefore is called "not-directing virtue [on the part of beings]."
sen.e: This does not mean practice when foolish beings direct their merit toward attaining birth, but is the practice fulfilled when Amida instructs out of great compassion.
This does not mean practice when foolish beings direct their merit toward attaining birth, but is the practice fulfilled when Amida instructs out of great compassion.

sen.j: 信も、凡夫が阿弥陀仏を信じるのではなく、本願の力によって信が凡夫に回向されるものである。
sen.e: Shinjin is not the belief which foolish beings have in Amida but is the one which is directed to them by the power of the Primal Vow.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Shinjin is not the belief that foolish beings have in Amida, but is what is instructed to them by the power of the Primal Vow.
Faith is not the belief that foolish beings have in Amida, but is what is instructed to them by the power of the Primal Vow.
sen.cmt: 前出用語に合わせました。

sen.j: 証もまた阿弥陀仏によって仕上げられたものであり、それが回向されるとみるのである。
sen.e: Similarly, it is explained that Realization is what is attained by Amida and is directed to beings.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Similarly, it is explained that Realization is what is attained by Amida and is directed to living beings.
Similarly, it is explained that Enlightenment is what is attained by Amida and is directed to living beings.
sen.cmt: 前出用語に合わせました。

sen.j: このように、教行信証すべてが阿弥陀仏によって仕上げられて、それが凡夫に回向されていると見ることから、他力回向といい、他力本願と言うのである。
